result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca L. Bula was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Stayed
Consecutive to: to any other sentence Defendant is serving.

miscConds.notes: Pay court costs and Domestic Abuse Surcharge.    If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Comply with conditions as stated in 13CF-462 and 14CF-171 and 14CF-248.
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent including a women's alternative to the DAAP, if there is one available.
6 Days of pretrial incarceration credit if probation is revoked.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rebecca L. Bula in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 13CF-462, 14CF-171, 248 and 316.

1:50 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.
Atty Knaapen addresses the Court.
Defendant will plead to Count 1 in 13CF-462. Count 2 dismissed and read in.
14CF-171 Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 2. Count 3 dismissed and read in
14CF-248 Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3. Count 4 dismissed and read in.
14CF-316 Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 3. Count 2 and Counts 4-6 dismissed and read in.
Defense would be free to argue.

Court will take a moment to review the complaints to decide if a PSI is necessary or not.
Court is familiar.
Court will not order a PSI.

Parties are prepared to go forward.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF-462 Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 14CF-171 Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 14CF-171 Count 2: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 14CF-248: Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 14CF-248: Count 2: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 14CF-248: Count 3: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 14CF-316: Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 14CF-316: Count 3: NO CONTEST

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Sheets for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
13CF-462: Count 1 contrary to the statute section stated therein, repeat offender
13CF-462: Count 2 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-171: Count 1 contrary to the statute section stated therein, repeat offender
14CF-171: Count 2 contrary to the statute section stated therein, repeat offender
14CF-171: Count 3 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-248: Count 1 contrary to the statute section stated therein, repeat offender
14CF-248: Count 2 contrary to the statute section stated therein, repeat offender
14CF-248: Count 3 contrary to the statute section stated therein, repeat offender
14CF-248: Count 4 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-316: Count 1 contrary to the statute section stated therein, repeat offender
14CF-316: Count 2 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-316: Count 3 contrary to the statute section stated therein, repeat offender
14CF-316: Count 4 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-316: Count 5 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-316: Count 6 Dismissed and Read In

State has complied with victim statute notifications.
A victim is present, wishes not to make a statement.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court, feels probation is appropriate with jail time.
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court, feels probation is appropriate.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.
State addresses previous convictions.
Court questions Defendant.

BY THE COURT:
13CF-462:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Jail sentence for 60 days
May be served on electronic monitor, day for day credit as long as Defendant abides by the jail's rules
Start sentence within 90 days of today's date
Huber granted for employment, counseling and child care
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or combination thereof unless Defendant has been found to be disabled and unable to work and/or go to school
Engage in any counseling as recommended by the agent
No contact with Steven Hageness and Loretta Nagorski
Pay court costs
Submit DNA Sample as a convicted felon
Court will not order the DNA Surcharge

14CF-171:
Count 1:
Impose and Stay a 50 Day Jail Sentence
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to 13CF-462
Conditions:
AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
Obtain all medications from 1 pharmacy
Sign all releases of information so agent can monitor and talk with doctor and pharmacy
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances
Engage in any other counseling as recommended by the agent
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 2:
Impose and Stay a 50 Day Jail Sentence, consecutive to Count 1
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to Count 1 
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

14CF-248:
Count 1:
Impose and Stay a 6 Month Jail Sentence consecutive to any other sentences
Probation for a period of 2 Years, concurrent to 13CF-462 and 14CF-171
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 13CF-462 and 14CF-171
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
 
Count 2:
Impose and Stay a 180 Day Jail Sentence concurrent to Count 1 but consecutive to any other sentences
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to Count 1, 13CF-462 and 14CF-171
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1, 13CF-462 and 14CF-171
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 3:
Impose and Stay a 180 Day Jail Sentence, concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2 but consecutive to any other sentences
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to Count 1, Count 2, 13CF-462 and 14CF-171
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1, Count 2, 13CF-462 and 14CF-171
Pay court costs

14CF-316:
Count 1:
Impose and Stay a 45 Day Jail Sentence, consecutive to any other sentence Defendant is serving
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to 13CF-462 and 14CF-171 and 14CF-248
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 13CF-462 and 14CF-171 and 14CF-248
Pay court costs
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent including a women's alternative to the DAAP if there is one available
6 Days of pretrial incarceration credit if probation is revoked

Count 3:
Impose and Stay a 45 Day Jail Sentence, concurrent to Count 1 but consecutive to any other sentence Defendant is serving
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to Count 1, 13CF-462 and 14CF-171 and 14CF-248
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1, 13CF-462 and 14CF-171 and 14CF-248
Pay court costs
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent including a women's alternative to the DAAP if there is one available

Any bond posted is to be applied to fines/costs.
Appeal rights are addressed.

2:42 PM Court is in recess.
Plea hearing on December 23, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 27, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Rebecca L. Bula in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Rebecca L. Bula in custody. ADA Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing. on 14CF316.  Casess 14CF248 and 14CF171 are following as status hearings. ANd 13CF462 to move from 09-16 to 10-27 at 10:00 a.m. State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.


Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Rebecca L. Bula in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

DA  Molepske appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

1:10 PM Court calls case.

DA Molepske  states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct, Criminal Damage to Property and Bailjumping.

Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant.
